VARDESC: Has there been any weight loss or weight gain?
Has there been any reduction in energy or increase in fatigue?
Has there been any difficulty grooming or bathing?
Has there been any difficulty in walking or moving around?
Has there been any difficulty driving?
Has there been any difficulty working full or part time?
VALUES: 1 = Able to carry on normal activity and to work. No special care needed.
column18: 2 = Unable to work. Able to live at home and care for most personal needs. A varying degree of assistance is needed.
column19: 3 = Unable to care for self. Requires equivalent of institutional or hospital care. Disease may be progressing rapidly.

COMMENT1: ASK IF 'Has there been any difficulty working full or part time?' = 'Able to carry on normal activity and to work. No special care needed.'
VALUES: 100 = Normal. No complaints. No evidence of disease.
column18: 90 = Able to carry on normal activity. Minor signs or symptoms of disease.
column19: 80 = Normal activity with effort. Some signs or symptoms of disease.

COMMENT1: ASK IF 'Has there been any difficulty working full or part time?' = 'Unable to work. Able to live at home and care for most personal needs. A varying degree of assistance is needed.'
VALUES: 70 = Cares for self. Unable to carry on normal activity or to do active work.
column18: 60 = Requires occasional assistance, but is able to care for most of personal needs.
column19: 50 = Requires considerable assistance and frequent medical care.

COMMENT1: ASK IF 'Has there been any difficulty working full or part time?' = 'Unable to care for self. Requires equivalent of institutional or hospital care. Disease may be progressing rapidly.'
VALUES: 40 = Disabled. Requires special care and assistance.
column18: 30 = Severely disabled. Hospital admission is indicated although death is not imminent.
column19: 20 = Hospitalization necessary. Very sick, active supportive treatment necessary.
